summary: This is an email from Nicole Simmons transmitting the unredacted reply brief for Ghislaine Maxwell's appeal (Case No. 20-3061) to the Second Circuit Court of Appeals. It shows legal team coordination in filing sealed documents.

persons.name: Nicole Simmons
persons.context: Sends the email transmitting Ghislaine Maxwell's unredacted reply brief to the Second Circuit Court of Appeals.

persons.name: Adam Mueller
persons.context: Requested that the unredacted reply brief be sent; copied on the email.

persons.name: Laura Menninger
persons.context: Named in the email signature block, indicating she is part of the law firm Haddon, Morgan and Foreman, P.C. representing Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the appeal case (US v. Maxwell); her reply brief is being filed.

connections.description: Menninger is a defense attorney at the law firm representing Maxwell in her appeal.
Both work at the same law firm, Haddon, Morgan and Foreman, P.C.
Simmons is sending documents at Mueller's request, indicating a professional legal coordination.

events.title: Filing of Unredacted Reply Brief
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell's legal team files an unredacted reply brief in her appeal (Case No. 20-3061) with the Second Circuit Court of Appeals.

keyFacts: The document is an email dated October 8, 2020, transmitting legal filings in Ghislaine Maxwell's appeal case (20-3061).
It shows Maxwell's legal team, including Laura Menninger of Haddon, Morgan and Foreman, P.C., actively filing an unredacted reply brief.
The communication indicates the use of sealed or confidential filings in the appellate process.
The email is part of the Epstein case document set, linking Maxwell's legal proceedings to the broader investigation.
